text: My mom was an aesthetician and she went to beauty school back in the '60s. I just remember watching her do her makeup all the time. She always had her nails done, makeup on - her face was ready to go when she went out. I loved it.
author: Emmanuelle Chriqui

text: I grew up in a family where we weren't allowed to talk about beauty or to put any emphasis on physical appearance.
author: Pam Grier

text: This whole beauty thing is something I've never comprehended.
author: Pam Grier

text: I thought of Paris as a beauty spot on the face of the earth, and of London as a big freckle.
author: James Weldon Johnson

text: We tell them that we believe it will be beautiful because that is our specialty, we only create joy and beauty. We have never done a sad work. Through the drawings, we hope a majority will be able to visualize it.
author: Christo
